intro: Hedeoma serpyllifolia, commonly known as common yarrow, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its basal rosette of linear, silver-gray leaves and its clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is known for its composite flower heads. Hedeoma serpyllifolia typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a garden plant due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
